AUTH_TOKEN.description: 2FA authentication secret for dynamic IP whitelisting. For your own good, this is required.

OKTA_BASEURL.description: Set if using Okta for authentication (otherwise leave blank). The issuer from your Okta account.

OKTA_CLIENTID.description: Set if using Okta for authentication (otherwise leave blank). The client id from your Okta account.

OKTA_ISSUER.description: Set if using Okta for authentication (otherwise leave blank). The issue from your Okta account, with '/oauth2/default' at the end.

SIMPLE_AUTH_USERNAME.description: For self-hosted authentication (otherwise leave blank). A username to require for login.

SIMPLE_AUTH_PASSWORD.description: For self-hosted authentication (otherwise leave blank). A password to require for login.

SIMPLE_AUTH_SECRET.description: For self-hosted authentication (otherwise leave blank). A long, random string of characters of any type.

SIMPLE_AUTH_SECOND_FACTOR.description: For self-hosted authentication (otherwise leave blank). You may either set this to the same value as AUTH_TOKEN, in which case there will be a single 2FA step for your application, or if you want to be super-secure, use a completely different 2FA code.

SIMPLE_AUTH_TOKEN_EXPIRY_MINUTES.description: For self-hosted authentication (otherwise leave blank). The time before each token issued will expire and the user will be forced to log in again, in minutes.

JAVA_OPTS.description: You generally shouldn't need to change any of this. It's been well tuned for a Hobby Heroku instance.

MAVEN_CUSTOM_GOALS.description: Used by the Heroku buildpack. Do not change.

MAVEN_CUSTOM_OPTS.description: Used by the Heroku buildpack. Do not change.

TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN.description: The Telegram bot API token. Can be omitted, in which case Telegram notifications won't be used.

TELEGRAM_CHAT_ID.description: The Telegram chat ID. May be omitted if TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN is.
